      boolean populateFieldInSectionWith(java.lang.String fieldName, java.lang.String sectionName, java.lang.String[] fieldValues)
      Populates a field in a section with specific values.

      This method is useful for populating fields without labels and can populate the following types of fields: Text, Paragraph, EncryptedText, Integer, Decimal, Date, Datetime, Select, MultipleSelect, Radio, Checkbox, FileUpload, UserPicker, GroupPicker, UserGroupPicker, DocumentPicker, FolderPicker, DocumentFolderPicker, CustomPicker.
      The method will attempt to fill the field the number of attemptTimes (default 3) and if failing all three times will return false.

      FitNesse Examples:
      | populate field | FIELD_NAME | in section | SECTION_NAME | with | FIELD_VALUE |
      | populate field | FIELD_NAME | in section | SECTION_NAME | with | VALUE_1,VALUE_2 | - For fields that allow multiple inputs (), comma separate the field values.
      | populate field | FIELD_NAME | in section | SECTION_NAME[1] | with | FIELD_VALUES | - For fields in sections with duplicate labels, an index of the section label on the page can be used in the format of [1], [2], or [5].
      boolean populateFieldWith(java.lang.String fieldName, java.lang.String[] fieldValues)
      Populates a field with specific values.

      This method can populate the following types of fields: Text, Paragraph, EncryptedText, Integer, Decimal, Date, Datetime, Select, MultipleSelect, Radio, Checkbox, FileUpload, UserPicker, GroupPicker, UserGroupPicker, DocumentPicker, FolderPicker, DocumentFolderPicker, CustomPicker.
      boolean populateFieldWithValue(java.lang.String fieldName, java.lang.String fieldValue)

      boolean populateGridColumnRowWith(java.lang.String gridName, java.lang.String columnName, java.lang.String rowNum, java.lang.String[] fieldValues)
      Populates fields in a grid.

      Selects a row in an editable or paging grid.

      FitNesse Examples:

      | select grid | GRID_NAME[2] | row | [2] | - If there are multiple grids with the same name, use the index to select the correct one.

      • populateFieldWith

        public boolean populateFieldWith(java.lang.String fieldName,
                                 java.lang.String[] fieldValues)
        Populates a field with specific values.

        This method can populate the following types of fields: Text, Paragraph, EncryptedText, Integer, Decimal, Date, Datetime, Select, MultipleSelect, Radio, Checkbox, FileUpload, UserPicker, GroupPicker, UserGroupPicker, DocumentPicker, FolderPicker, DocumentFolderPicker, CustomPicker. The only fields that support population of multiple items are Checkbox, MultipleSelect, and all Pickers. The method will attempt to fill the field the number of attemptTimes (default 3) and if failing all three times will return false.

        FitNesse Examples:
        | populate field | FIELD_NAME | with | FIELD_VALUE |
        | populate field | FIELD_NAME | with | VALUE_1,VALUE_2 | - For fields that allow multiple inputs (), comma separate the field values.
        | populate field | FIELD_NAME[2] | with | FIELD_VALUES | - For fields with duplicate labels, an index of the field label on the page can be used in the format of [1], [2], or [5]. As with Appian, indexing starts with 1.
        | populate field | FIELD_NAME | with | +4 hours | - For date and datetime fields, relative times can be entered such as +1 minute, +2 hours, +3 days. To use these relative times, the startDatetime must be initialized: see BaseFixture.setStartDatetime()
        Parameters:
        fieldName - Can either be the label of the field or a label with an index
        fieldValues - An array of strings containing the values to populate into the interface
        Returns:
        True, if action completed successfully

      • populateFieldWithValue

        public boolean populateFieldWithValue(java.lang.String fieldName,
                                      java.lang.String fieldValue)
        Populates a field with a single value that may contain a comma. This is useful is selecting an option that contains a comma.

        FitNesse Example: | populate field | FIELD_NAME | with value | VALUE |
        Parameters:
        fieldName - Field label or label and index
        fieldValue - Field value, can contain a comma.
        Returns:
        True, if action completes successfully

      • populateFieldInSectionWith

        public boolean populateFieldInSectionWith(java.lang.String fieldName,
                                          java.lang.String sectionName,
                                          java.lang.String[] fieldValues)
        Populates a field in a section with specific values.

        This method is useful for populating fields without labels and can populate the following types of fields: Text, Paragraph, EncryptedText, Integer, Decimal, Date, Datetime, Select, MultipleSelect, Radio, Checkbox, FileUpload, UserPicker, GroupPicker, UserGroupPicker, DocumentPicker, FolderPicker, DocumentFolderPicker, CustomPicker.
        The method will attempt to fill the field the number of attemptTimes (default 3) and if failing all three times will return false.

        FitNesse Examples:
        | populate field | FIELD_NAME | in section | SECTION_NAME | with | FIELD_VALUE |
        | populate field | FIELD_NAME | in section | SECTION_NAME | with | VALUE_1,VALUE_2 | - For fields that allow multiple inputs (), comma separate the field values.
        | populate field | FIELD_NAME | in section | SECTION_NAME[1] | with | FIELD_VALUES | - For fields in sections with duplicate labels, an index of the section label on the page can be used in the format of [1], [2], or [5]. As with Appian, indexing starts with 1.
        | populate field | FIELD_NAME | in section | SECTION_NAME | with | +4 hours | - For date and datetime fields, relative times can be entered such as +1 minute, +2 hours, +3 days. To use these relative times, the startDatetime must be initialized: see BaseFixture.setStartDatetime()
        Parameters:
        fieldName - Can either be the label of the field or label with an index
        sectionName - Can either be the label of the section or an label with an index
        fieldValues - An array of strings containing the values to populate into the interface
        Returns:
        True, if action completed successfully

      • getFieldValue

        public java.lang.String getFieldValue(java.lang.String fieldName)
        Returns the value of a field.

        FitNesse Examples:
        | get field | FIELD_NAME | value | - Simply returns a string
        | set | get field | FIELD_NAME | value | fieldValue | - Stores the field value in fieldValue, which can later be accessed using @{fieldValue} | check | get field | FIELD_NAME | FIELD_VALUE | - Returns true if the field value title matches the FIELD_VALUE input. For file upload fields, do not include the full path. This will not work for relative date and datetime fields.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - Name of name and index of the field
        Returns:
        The field value

      • verifyFieldContains

        public boolean verifyFieldContains(java.lang.String fieldName,
                                   java.lang.String[] fieldValues)
        Verifies a field contains a specific value.

        FitNesse Examples:
        | verify field | FIELD_NAME | contains | VALUES | | verify field | FIELD_NAME | contains | +4 hours | - For date and datetime fields, relative times can be entered such as +1 minute, +2 hours, +3 days. To use these relative times, the startDatetime must be initialized: see BaseFixture.setStartDatetime()
        Parameters:
        fieldName - Can either be a name or a name and index, e.g. 'Text Field' or 'Text Field[1]'
        fieldValues - Values to compare field value against
        Returns:
        True, if the field contains the value

      • populateGridColumnRowWith

        public boolean populateGridColumnRowWith(java.lang.String gridName,
                                         java.lang.String columnName,
                                         java.lang.String rowNum,
                                         java.lang.String[] fieldValues)
        Populates fields in a grid. This method is useful for populating the following types of fields: Text, Paragraph, EncryptedText, Integer, Decimal, Date, Datetime, Select, MultipleSelect, Radio, Checkbox, FileUpload, UserPicker, GroupPicker, UserGroupPicker, DocumentPicker, FolderPicker, DocumentFolderPicker, CustomPicker.

        FitNesse Examples:
        | populate grid | GRID_NAME | column | COLUMN_NAME | row | ROW_INDEX | with | VALUE |
        | populate grid | GRID_NAME | column | COLUMN_INDEX | row | ROW_INDEX | with | VALUE | - The column index can be used if the columns do not have titles. As with Appian indexing starts with [1] and if the table has checkboxes, they are considered to be in the first column.
        | populate grid | GRID_NAME[3] | column | COLUMN_NAME | row | ROW_INDEX | with | VALUE | - If there are multiple grids with the same name then use an index, e.g. 'Grid Name[3]' with select the third grid with the name of 'Grid Name' in the interface
        Parameters:
        gridName - Name of grid
        columnName - Name or index of the column
        rowNum - Index of the row
        fieldValues - Values to populate
        Returns:
        True, if action completed successfully

      • getGridColumnRowValue

        public java.lang.String getGridColumnRowValue(java.lang.String gridName,
                                              java.lang.String columnName,
                                              java.lang.String rowNum)
        Returns the value of a field.

        FitNesse Examples:
        | get grid | GRID_NAME | column | COLUMN_NAME | row | ROW_INDEX| value | - Simply returns a string
        | set | get grid | GRID_NAME | column | COLUMN_NAME | row | ROW_INDEX| value | fieldValue | - Stores the field value in fieldValue, which can later be accessed using @{fieldValue} | check | get grid | GRID_NAME | column | COLUMN_NAME | row | ROW_INDEX| value | FIELD_VALUE | - Returns true if the field value title matches the FIELD_VALUE input. For file upload fields, do not include the full path. This will not work for relative date and datetime fields.
        Parameters:
        gridName - Name of the grid
        columnName - Name or index of the column
        rowNum - Index of the row
        Returns:
        The field value

      • selectGridRow

        public boolean selectGridRow(java.lang.String gridName,
                             java.lang.String rowNum)
        Selects a row in an editable or paging grid.

        FitNesse Examples:
        | select grid | GRID_NAME | row | [1] |
        | select grid | GRID_NAME[2] | row | [2] | - If there are multiple grids with the same name, use the index to select the correct one. As with Appian, indexing starts with [1].
        Parameters:
        gridName - Can either be the grid name or grid name with index, e.g. 'Grid Name' or 'Grid Name[2]'
        rowNum - Index of row to select, e.g. [2]
        Returns:
        True, if action completed successfully
